text.0: where in the heavens are ye today gods aśvins rich in constancy.
text.1: hear this ye excellent as steers atri inviteth you to come.
text.2: where are they now where are the twain the famed nāsatyas gods in heaven.
text.3: who is the man ye strive to reach who of your suppliants is with you.
text.4: whom do ye visit whom approach to whom direct your harnessed car.
text.5: with whose devotions are ye pleased we long for you to further us.
text.6: ye strengtheners for paura stir the filler swimming in the flood.
text.7: advancing to be captured like a lion to the ambuscade.
text.8: ye from cyavana worn with age removed his skin as twere a robe.
text.9: so when ye made him young again he stirred the longing of a dame.
text.10: here is the man who lauds you both to see your glory are we here.
text.11: now bear me come with saving help ye who are rich in store of wealth.
text.12: who among many mortal men this day hath won you to himself.
text.13: what bard accepters of the bard who rich in wealth with sacrifice.
text.14: o aśvins may your car approach most excellent of cars for speed.
text.15: through many regions may our praise pass onward among mortal men.
text.16: may our laudation of you twain lovers of meath be sweet to you.
text.17: fly hitherward ye wise of heart like falcons with your winged steeds.
text.18: o aśvins when at any time ye listen to this call of mine.
text.19: for you is dainty food prepared they mix refreshing food for you.
